s.text: Written comments on the unapproved collections are requested and no one need respond to such collections until approved by OMB.

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Health Resources and Services Administration, entitled "Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network" (RIN: 0906-AA32).

Pursuant to section 801(a)(2)(A) of title 5, United States Code, this is our report on a major rule promulgated by the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Health Resources and Services Administration, entitled "Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network" (RIN: 0906-AA32).

Regarding benefits, HHS discusses the use of the value of a statistical life as a quantifying benefit and the fact that, in the area of transplantation, the usefulness of such a measure is reduced because of the older average age of recipients and the substantial risk of either the graft or the patient not surviving.
HHS recognizes in its analysis the difficulty of quantifying the costs and the benefits of the rule.
Another benefit of the rule is the public oversight and accountability of the organ transplant system, which will preserve public trust and confidence.
